results.title: [HYPERTENSION IN A YOUNG WOMAN WITH ANXIETY DISORDER: THE CHICKEN OR THE EGG?]
results.text_hl: Approximately 10 days post-surgery, her @DISEASE_Hypertension @DISEASE_MESH:D006973 @@@blood pressure@@@ values were measured in a range of 125/90 and @<m>DISEASE_Anxiety</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D001007 @@@anxiety@@@ significantly improved, under treatment only with 12.5mg @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@Atenolol@@@.

results.title: The treatment of anxiety with beta-blocking drugs.
results.text_hl: A placebo-controlled trial is described, in which @CHEMICAL_Propranolol @CHEMICAL_MESH:D011433 @@@propranolol@@@ and @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@ were both effective in the symptomatic treatment of generalized @<m>DISEASE_Anxiety</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D001007 @@@anxiety@@@ in @SPECIES_9606 @@@patients@@@ who had been referred by their family doctors for specialist treatment.

citations.NLM: Peet M. The treatment of anxiety with beta-blocking drugs. Postgrad Med J. 1988;64 Suppl 2():45-9. PMID: 2905798

results.title: Phenelzine and atenolol in social phobia.
results.text_hl: @CHEMICAL_Phenelzine @CHEMICAL_MESH:D010624 @@@Phenelzine@@@ appeared to be a particularly effective treatment for the generalized form of @DISEASE_Phobia_Social @DISEASE_MESH:D000072861 @@@social phobia@@@. @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@Atenolol@@@ may be useful for discrete forms of @DISEASE_Phobia_Social @DISEASE_MESH:D000072861 @@@social phobia@@@ such as performance @<m>DISEASE_Anxiety</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D001007 @@@anxiety@@@.

citations.NLM: Liebowitz MR, Schneier F, Campeas R, Gorman J, Fyer A, Hollander E, Hatterer J, Papp L. Phenelzine and atenolol in social phobia. Psychopharmacol Bull. 1990;26(1):123-5. PMID: 2196620
citations.BibTeX: @article{2196620, title={Phenelzine and atenolol in social phobia.}, author={Liebowitz MR and Schneier F and Campeas R and Gorman J and Fyer A and Hollander E and Hatterer J and Papp L}, journal={Psychopharmacol Bull}, volume={26}, number={1}, pages={123-5}}

results.title: [Quality of life of patients with old myocardial infarction on prolonged therapy with atenolol].
results.text_hl: QL was evaluated before and during the course of therapy (after 1, 3, 6, and 12 months) using EORTC QLQ CORE 30, short version of MMPI test, and Spielberg State-Trait @<m>DISEASE_Anxiety</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D001007 @@@Anxiety@@@ inventory. The @SPECIES_9606 @@@patients@@@ received @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@ in effective doses selected on an individual basis (mean day dose was 67.9 +/- 4.2 mg) within one year; the study revealed increase of QL falling in all the categories of EORTC QLQ CORE 30, decrease of reactive and personal @<m>DISEASE_Anxiety</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D001007 @@@anxiety@@@, as well as positive changes in averaged MMPI profile, which reflected lowering of @<m>DISEASE_Anxiety</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D001007 @@@anxiety@@@ and @DISEASE_Depressive_Disorder @DISEASE_MESH:D003866 @@@depression@@@ level in the actual psyche status.

citations.NLM: Kaliuzhin VV, Tepliakov AT, Kaliuzhina EV, Solovtsev MA, Maleeva MA, Pushnikova EIu. [Quality of life of patients with old myocardial infarction on prolonged therapy with atenolol]. Klin Med (Mosk). 2006;84(1):50-2. PMID: 16512398
citations.BibTeX: @article{16512398, title={[Quality of life of patients with old myocardial infarction on prolonged therapy with atenolol].}, author={Kaliuzhin VV and Tepliakov AT and Kaliuzhina EV and Solovtsev MA and Maleeva MA and Pushnikova EIu}, journal={Klin Med (Mosk)}, volume={84}, number={1}, pages={50-2}}
